title: Deadline nears for HREI Insights Awards
text:
Entries are due in one week – by Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 – for the third annual awards recognizing excellence in healthcare real estate development and leadership
MINNEAPOLIS (PRWEB) September 25, 2015
The deadline is fast approaching to submit entries to the 2015 HREI Insights Awards . The last day to submit entries to the only comprehensive national awards program totally dedicated to recognizing excellence in the areas of healthcare real estate development and executive leadership are due in one week, on Friday, Oct. 2.
The awards are presented by Healthcare Real Estate Insights, the first and only national magazine entirely devoted to covering healthcare real estate (HRE) development, financing and investment.
“Now in its third year, the HREI Insights Awards program has been very well received and popular with healthcare real estate executives,” says HREI Publisher Murray W. Wolf. “Every year, we enjoy honoring the most innovative, strategic and successful healthcare developments in the industry, as well as the remarkable accomplishments of industry leaders.”
The awards will be presented during a live luncheon presentation Thursday, Dec. 3, 2015, at the RealShare HRE Conference in Scottsdale, Ariz., one of the year’s largest gatherings of HRE professionals and healthcare executives. For more information on the conference, please visit the RealShare website.
HREI Editor John B. Mugford noted, “We’ll be excited to feature the winners and finalists in upcoming editions of HREI magazine, the 2016 HREI Resource Guide and on the HREInsights.com website, as well as during the live award ceremony in December at RealShare. We’re proud that a number of HRE executives have told us this program has become one of their favorite annual industry events.”
Sponsors of the 2015 HREI Insights Awards are:
Platinum Sponsor: GE Capital Healthcare Financial Services
Gold Sponsors: Health Care REIT, Duke Realty, Caddis and ALM RealShare
Silver sponsors: Griffin-American Healthcare REIT III, Rendina Healthcare Real Estate, MedProperties Holdings, HealthAmerica Realty Group, NexCore Group, Lillibridge and Pacific Medical Buildings
“We sincerely appreciate the generous support our sponsors have given to this awards program,” Mr. Wolf says. “Without their kind assistance and encouragement, this awards program would not be possible.”
Reduce entry fee for 2015
New this year is a reduced entry fee for the HREI Insights Awards. The fee is now $200 per entry with no limit on the number of entries submitted. Entries must be submitted online at HREI Insights Awards .
As noted above, all entries must be submitted by Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. Finalists will be notified by HREI staff in October and winners will be announced Dec. 3 at the RealShare conference .
The awards will be awarded in nine categories:
Medical Office Buildings and Other Outpatient Facilities - Best New Ground-Up Development (four awards in four different size ranges: less than 25,000 square feet, 25,000-49,999 square feet, 50,000-99,999 square feet, and 100,000 square feet or more)
Medical Office Buildings and Other Outpatient Facilities - Best Renovated or Repurposed Building (one award)
Hospitals and Other Inpatient Facilities - Best New Ground-Up Development (one award)
Post-Acute and Senior Living Facilities - Best New Ground-Up Development (one award)
Healthcare Executive of the Year (one award)
Lifetime Achievement Award/Healthcare Real Estate Hall of Fame (one award)
Any project completed or scheduled to be completed by Dec. 31, 2015 is eligible. Preference will be given to projects completed in 2015, but exceptional projects from previous years also will be considered. Healthcare real estate professional from both healthcare real estate firms and hospitals, health systems and physician practice groups are eligible to enter the Healthcare Executive of the Year and Lifetime Achievement Award categories.
For comprehensive details on the 2015 HREI Insights Awards, including award categories, how to enter, the schedule and judging process, judging criteria, and what winners and finalists will receive, please visit HREI Insights Awards .
About Healthcare Real Estate Insights
Launched in 2003, HREI was the first and remains the only national magazine entirely dedicated to covering healthcare real estate development, financing and investment. This monthly, national, business-to-business magazine offers sophisticated players the most comprehensive coverage in the industry available anywhere. Introduced in 2008, the HREI Resource Guide was the first and is still the only annual directory of healthcare real estate services. And HREI’s companion website, HREInsights.com, has been totally redesigned and vastly expanded with more than 10 years of content, more than 2,000 articles and nearly 2 million words of copy, becoming the new hub for healthcare real estate news and information.
For more information on HREI products and services, or to subscribe or advertise, please visit us at HREInsights.com .
